message: January is National Slavery and Human Trafficking Prevention Month, designed to draw awareness to our national problem with modern-day slavery. The Global Slavery Index — a country-by-country survey of human trafficking performed by anti-slavery nonprofit the Walk Free Foundation — estimates there are 57,700 people living in slavery in the United States.

data.description: January is National Slavery and Human Trafficking Prevention Month, designed to draw awareness to our national problem with modern-day slavery.
data.title: Human trafficking a national problem
